head.title: Perry Waived As the Nets Keep Ollie

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/Sports/Pro Basketball/National Basketball Association/New Jersey Nets

hedline.hl1: Perry Waived As the Nets Keep Ollie

abstract.p: New Jersey Nets waive Elliot Perry (S)

block.p: After much agonizing, the Nets waived Elliot Perry yesterday. The ninth-year backup point guard has a $2.8 million guaranteed salary this year. Perry came to the Nets as part of the Stephon Marbury trade in March 1999.

''I've always landed on my feet, but it's a better cushion when you have a contract,'' said Perry, who averaged 5.3 points and 2.3 assists in 60 games last season but was hindered by a hip flexor in training camp.

''I've always landed on my feet, but it's a better cushion when you have a contract,'' said Perry, who averaged 5.3 points and 2.3 assists in 60 games last season but was hindered by a hip flexor in training camp.
The Nets also waived Kevin Freeman, the rookie free-agent shooting guard from the University of Connecticut.
Kevin Ollie, a free-agent backup point guard, secured the final spot on the 12-man active roster.
Ollie signed a $548,500 nonguaranteed contract the second day of training camp after Lucious Harris was set for hernia surgery.
Last season, Ollie was the backup point guard for the Philadelphia 76ers and played in 10 playoff games.
The Nets think Harris could return sooner than expected, perhaps missing only three games.
